Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

Welcome Commander! I am A.I.V.A., your Autonomous Integrated Virtual Assistant, standard issue for every planetary governor of the Star Union.[br/][br/]My messages will appear when important actions are undertaken for the first time. They can be reviewed at any time in the [hyperlink,00000322000000E0]Imperial Archives[/hyperlink], in The Basics section.[br/][br/]The [recommended/] icon and color will assist in early decisions by recommending certain choices to direct the development of your starting empire.

All mentions to Commander are towards the Player behind the computer screen, not the Leader or hero unit in game. The mention of AIVA is a female AI program (voice-over will be female). All mentions of 'you' is also direct to the player behind the screen.
Added periods in the name A.I.V.A.

Cell.ss:HRef: mailto:%7BXML_TUTORIAL@GAME_START@TUTORIAL_DESCRIPTION%7D[br/][br/]These messages can be disabled or reset at any time in the Options menu of your command interface, which can be accessed via the button in%
Cell.Data: {XML_TUTORIAL@GAME_START@TUTORIAL_DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/]These messages can be disabled or reset at any time in the Options menu of your command interface, which can be accessed via the button in the top right of the interface.[br/][br/]Do you wish to enable the help messages?
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

You can pan the camera using the arrow keys or {KEYBIND_ID_6}/{KEYBIND_ID_7}/{KEYBIND_ID_8}/{KEYBIND_ID_9} keys, and zoom in and out using the [middlemousebutton/] on your mouse. Additionally the camera can be moved by holding down the [leftmousebutton/] button and moving the mouse. [br/][br/]Selecting is done by clicking the [leftmousebutton/] button. To deselect something, use the [leftmousebutton/] button anywhere else.

You can pan the camera using [controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt], and zoom in and out using [controllerprompt][xbox_rs/][/controllerprompt]. Selecting is done with [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt] and deselecting is done with [controllerprompt][xbox_b/][/controllerprompt]. [controllerprompt][xbox_y/][/controllerprompt] brings up a radial menu, which allows access to the in-game menus.

Accessing Info Mode provides more information on various aspects of the most relevant interfaces. You can enter info mode by pressing the [controllerprompt][xbox_windows/][/controllerprompt]button and using[controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt] to move to different elements of the interface.

This is the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] interface. It allows you to inspect and control your settlements on this planet. The tabs at the top left cycle through the production and colonist options.

In this document, all words in between the [Hyperlink] sections are imperial archive entries, our manual in game, and will need to have the same name as those imperial archive entries, though they can be plural or singular, as is fitting for the sentence (colony or colonies is fine)

Under this colony's name, you can see the amount of each [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF4]Resource[/hyperlink] this colony generates. [br/][br/]A description and a breakdown of the colony's income can be found in the tooltips of each resource.
{XML_TUTORIAL@RESOURCES@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Tooltips can be viewed by hovering over an interface element with the mouse.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

{XML_TUTORIAL@RESOURCES@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Tooltips can be seen in Info Mode by pressing [controllerprompt][xbox_windows/][/controllerprompt] on your controller and using [controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt] to move to each individual element.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

The currently selected colony tab is ‘Unit Production’. All [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] available for construction are listed here. More units are unlocked through research and by building their prerequisite structure.[br/][br/]Units cost both production and energy to build, and higher tier units also cost [hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink] [tricorium/].

{XML_TUTORIAL@UNIT_PRODUCTION@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can add a unit to the production queue by double-clicking [leftmousebutton/] or by selecting it and clicking the 'Produce' button.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

{XML_TUTORIAL@UNIT_PRODUCTION@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can scroll through the list of available units using [controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt], and select a unit to be produced using the [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt] button.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.
Units and structures can be built in a colony by selecting the ‘Produce’ option, which places them in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000295]Production Queue.[/hyperlink]

{XML_TUTORIAL@PRODUCTION_QUEUE@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]The order of the production projects in the queue can be changed by hovering over them and selecting the up arrow that appears. Clicking the 'X' will remove a production project from the queue altogether.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

Cell.ss:HRef: mailto:%7BXML_TUTORIAL@PRODUCTION_QUEUE@DESCRIPTION%7D[br/][br/][recommendedcol]The order of the production projects in the queue can be changed by selecting them using [controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt] and%2
Cell.Data: {XML_TUTORIAL@PRODUCTION_QUEUE@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]The order of the production projects in the queue can be changed by selecting them using [controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt] and pressing the [controllerprompt][xbox_x/][/controllerprompt] button. Pressing the [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt] button will remove a production project from the queue altogether.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.
This is the Structure Production tab. [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink] can be built from here to unlock new units, strengthen the economy and bolster the colony's defenses.

{XML_TUTORIAL@STRUCTURE_PRODUCTION@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can add a structure to the production queue by double-clicking the [leftmousebutton/] button or by selecting it and clicking the 'Produce' button.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

Cell.ss:HRef: mailto:%7BXML_TUTORIAL@STRUCTURE_PRODUCTION@DESCRIPTION%7D[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can scroll through the list of available structures using [controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt], and select a structure to be%
Cell.Data: {XML_TUTORIAL@STRUCTURE_PRODUCTION@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can scroll through the list of available structures using [controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt], and select a structure to be produced using [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt].[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

The Sector Production tab lists the structures that can be built in any of the [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] of the colony.[br/][br/]A sector can be [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Exploited[/hyperlink] in one of four resources (energy[energy/], food[supply/], knowledge[research/] or production[production/]) by building the appropriate building in that sector.

{XML_TUTORIAL@SECTOR_PRODUCTION@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can add a structure to the production queue by double-clicking [leftmousebutton/] or by selecting it and clicking the 'Produce' button.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

{XML_TUTORIAL@SECTOR_PRODUCTION@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can scroll through the list of available structures using [controllerprompt][xbox_ls/][/controllerprompt] and you can select a structure to be produced using the [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt] button.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

The colonist tab lists details of the colony's [hyperlink,000003AC000002B7]Growth[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000026]Happiness.[/hyperlink] The colony’s output can be fine-tuned by assigning [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] to [hyperlink,000003AC000002B6]Resource Slots.[/hyperlink][br/][br/] New Commanders can best keep Colonist Management and Food Sharing on the default settings.

Welcome to the Research Center, Commander. Here we allocate [hyperlink,000003AC00000025]Knowledge[/hyperlink] [research/] to rediscover the technologies of the Star Union and search for new frontiers. The two tracks can be reseached in parallel:[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]Military Research[/bullet][br/][bullet]Society Research[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/][hyperlink,000003AC00000025]Knowledge[/hyperlink] is applied to both types of research equally at the end of each turn.

{XML_TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]You can click[rightmousebutton/] on the components the research skills unlock to go to the relevant Imperial Archive entry[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

{XML_TUTORIAL@RESEARCH@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Pressing [controllerprompt][xbox_x/][/controllerprompt] will show more information on the components of the currently highlighted research skill.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

[hyperlink,000003AC00000262]Military Research[/hyperlink] concerns unit unlocks, unit mods and military operations. It is divided into three categories:[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]Racial research[/bullet][br/][bullet]Weapons research[/bullet][br/][bullet]Secret Technology research[/bullet][/bulletlist]

[hyperlink,000003AC00000263]Society Research[/hyperlink] concerns economic development, governmental policies and espionage. It is divided into three categories:[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]Doctrine research unlock governmental policies to steer your empire.[/bullet][br/][bullet]Economy research focuses on the development of your colonies.[/bullet][br/][bullet]Operations research increases operation effectiveness, and unlocks covert operations[/bullet][/bulletlist]

This is an [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army.[/hyperlink] Armies contain up to 6 units on a single [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex,[/hyperlink] and are used to explore the world, attack enemy armies and defend colonies.[br/][br/]Selecting a unit's portrait in the army panel below will display its abilities.
{XML_TUTORIAL@UNITS@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Clicking [leftmousebutton/] on a unit's portrait in the army panel below will open the unit panel for that unit.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

{XML_TUTORIAL@UNITS@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]By pressing the [controllerprompt][xbox_dp_up/][/controllerprompt] button, the army panel can be accessed where individual units in the army can be selected. Pressing the [controllerprompt][xbox_x/][/controllerprompt] button will open the unit panel of the currently selected unit.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

To move an army, select it and then move the cursor to the hex you want it to go to. A preview of the route is shown, with a blue path to indicate how far the army can move this turn.[br/][br/]Each hex has a [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Point[/hyperlink] cost, and each unit has a set number of move points per turn.

{XML_TUTORIAL@MOVEMENT@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Units can be selected using [leftmousebutton/]; clicking [rightmousebutton/] over a hex will move the selected army towards that hex.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

Cell.ss:HRef: mailto:%7BXML_TUTORIAL@MOVEMENT@DESCRIPTION%7D[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Units can be selected using [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt]; pressing [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt] over a hex will move the%2
Cell.Data: {XML_TUTORIAL@MOVEMENT@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Units can be selected using [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt]; pressing [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt] over a hex will move the selected army towards that hex.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

Armies with multiple units can be split into smaller, separate armies. To split an army, select the move point button positioned above the portrait of the unit(s) you want to remove from the selected army. When all units that you want to split off are selected, move the units as normal to create a new army. The army's other units will stay in place.

{XML_TUTORIAL@ARMY_SPLITTING@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]By pressing [controllerprompt][xbox_dp_up/][/controllerprompt], the army panel can be accessed where individual units in the army can be selected. Pressing the [controllerprompt][xbox_a/][/controllerprompt] button will highlight units to split off from the main army. [/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

This is the unit panel where all the information on a unit can be viewed, including their active and passive abilities in the list on the left side. [br/][br/]Once researched, [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink] can be assigned to a unit using the mod slots on the right.

Units can have different roles in combat.[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000029B]Core units[/hyperlink] are a race's scouts and baseline infantry.[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000028B]Skirmisher units[/hyperlink] are focused on dealing damage.[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000028A]Specialist units[/hyperlink] have non-damaging support abilities in addition to their attacks.[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000028C]Elite units[/hyperlink] are higher tier units that have strong damage and support abilities.[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]A colony can only produce skirmisher, specialist and elite units if it has built special [hyperlink,000003AC000002A4]Unit Unlock Structures.[/hyperlink]

Mods allow you to improve your units later in the game, and allow you to adapt your arsenal to ever-evolving threats. [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink] include a variety of offensive and defensive modifications, while others provide entirely new abilties.[br/][br/]Unit Mods can be unlocked through [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] or bought from [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Factions.[/hyperlink]

Once mods have been assigned to a unit, a new template needs to be made for the modified unit. Every template is unique, with its own name and icon, and changing the mods on a unit with an existing template will prompt the creation of a new template for that unit. A template can also be used to simultaneously upgrade all existing units of the same type.

[hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Heroes[/hyperlink] are special units that lead your armies. [hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]Commander,[/hyperlink] you are also represented as a hero on the map. [br/][br/]As heroes level up, they gain [hyperlink,000003AC00000328]Skill Points[/hyperlink] that can be spent to unlock unique hero abilities using this interface. Many hero abilties buff the entire army they are leading. Next to unit mods, heroes have the ability to wield legendary Hero Items that can be found while exploring the strategic map.

These are [hyperlink,000003AC000000A3]Marauders,[/hyperlink] hostile armies that either roam around the planet looking for locations to attack or camp on [hyperlink,0000039A00000928]Spawners[/hyperlink] to defend them. Spawners will periodically spawn roaming marauder armies. Spawners can be destroyed by defeating its defenders and moving an army on top of it.[br/][br/]Marauders will increase in strength the longer the game goes on, so exterminate them early!

These are [hyperlink,000003CF0000009E]Marauder Guards.[/hyperlink] Having taken a location of value, they will remain there and protect it with their lives. As with regular marauders, they do not engage in diplomacy, and will grow stronger as the game goes on.

This is an army belonging to an [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Faction,[/hyperlink] a group of sentient beings native to this planet. NPC Factions can be interacted with, and will provide quests and issue demands. Appeasing an NPC faction leads to diplomatic benefits, such as the ability to purchase their units or to call the faction to [hyperlink,000003AC00000310]War[/hyperlink] as allies.

Planets are divided into geographical sectors that contain natural resources or valuable remnants of the Star Union. Sectors can be settled with colonizers or annexed as provinces to existing colonies by interacting with the central sector map marker.[br/][br/]Actions available to take within the sector are listed in the bottom panel.

Sectors usually have both a [hyperlink,000003BD00001313]Clime[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain[/hyperlink] feature that determine their economic potential.[br/][br/]In addition, sectors can contain locations such as [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Resource Nodes,[/hyperlink] [hyperlink,0000039A00000925]Visit Sites[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039C00001C1A]Hazards[/hyperlink] which can add economic or strategic value to the sector.[br/][br/]Hazards and special combat effects are also listed in this panel.

To make your colonies thrive, sectors need to be annexed to colony centers. This turns them into [hyperlink,000003BD000016D5]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] that add income to their parent colony once they are further developed.[br/][br/]Through experience, you will learn how to optimize sector choices and colony upgrades. For now, pick any habitable sector adjacent to your starting colony, and annex it.

You have just annexed a sector, and it can now be [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Exploited[/hyperlink] for one of the main resources. Ideally, the chosen exploitation type matches the terrain and clime features of the sector for future leveling potential. [br/][br/]Exploitations are built via the colony center interface, in the Sector Production tab. The higher the [hyperlink,000003AC000002B8]Level[/hyperlink] of the exploitation, the more income it provides.[br/][br/]After the sector has been exploited, a [hyperlink,000003AC000002A7]Specialization[/hyperlink] can be built in it for more benefits. Conduct [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] to unlock sector specializations.

[hyperlink,0000039A00000929]Pickups[/hyperlink] are one-time collectables that provide [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF4]Resources[/hyperlink] or other rewards. They are instant bonuses that are given to the player who first collects them by moving a unit on top of them. [br/][br/]Once a pickup is collected, it is removed from the world. Better pickups are often defended by armies that need to be defeated before the pickup can be collected.

[hyperlink,0000039A00000925]Visit Sites[/hyperlink] are remnants of the Star Union that give a visiting army a boost. This can either be an instant effect or an effect that lasts until the end of the units' next combat.[br/][br/]Visit sites also provide minor economic benefits when their sector is [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] to a colony.

[hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Resource Nodes[/hyperlink] are remnants of the Star Union that provide economic bonuses when their sector is [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] to a colony.[br/][br/]Resource nodes give a synergy bonus when their sector's [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Exploitation[/hyperlink] matches the resource that they provide.

[hyperlink,0000039C00001C1A]Hazards[/hyperlink] linger as a reminder of weapons of mass destruction that were deployed in the past. They have a sector-wide effect on any armies in their sector, both on the world map and in tactical combat in that sector.[br/][br/]Hazards apply an economic penalty to the colony center when they are in one of its sectors. A hazard can be removed by using the [hyperlink,000003BD000011CB]Remove Hazard[/hyperlink] operation while a unit is standing on top of it. [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] must be conducted to unlock this operation.

[hyperlink,000003AC000000F1]Imperial Defenses[/hyperlink] are remnants of Star Union planetary defense systems. They have a sector-wide effect on any armies in the sector they are in, including tactical combat maps in the sector.[br/][br/]Clearing and claiming these structures allows the owning commander to use unique [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] within this sector on an owned colony.[br/]These operations are available only when the Imperial Defense structure remains owned by that commander.

[hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] are remnants of powerful Star Union structures. There are three kinds of landmarks: Bronze[monumentbronze/], Silver[monumentgrey/] and Gold[monumentgold/], with increasing economic value. [br/][br/]Landmarks have an inherent [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Exploitation[/hyperlink] with Gold and Silver landmarks automatically counting as a Level 5 sector. Landmarks unlock special [hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000002D8]Colony Structures[/hyperlink] when they are [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed.[/hyperlink]
{XML_TUTORIAL@LANDMARKS@TUTORIAL_DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/]Gold and Silver landmarks first need to be entered to defeat the guards within.
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

This location belongs to an [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Faction[/hyperlink] who may provide you with quests and make demands of you. Appeasing an NPC faction leads to diplomatic benefits, such as the ability to purchase their units and being able to call the faction to [hyperlink,000003AC00000310]War[/hyperlink] as allies.[br/][br/]On the right side of the interface, further information on the relation state is shown as well as the NPC Faction Shop, where the various trading options with the faction are located. Don't anger too many NPC factions at once, Commander, or your stay on this planet will be short-lived indeed!

[hyperlink,000003AC000002E5]Events[/hyperlink] listed in the right side of the screen are significant developments that happen during the course of a game. They include diplomatic messages, battle reports and notifications from your colonies.

The [hyperlink,000003AC000000B9]Task Notifier[/hyperlink] shows actions available during the current turn, as well as urgent matters that require attention. The task notifier is located below the event list and above the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E0]Minimap.[/hyperlink][br/][br/]Selecting a message from the task notifier will either center the camera on the relevant location or open the relevant interface.
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.
{XML_TUTORIAL@TASK_NOTIFIER@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Pressing [controllerprompt][xbox_rt/][/controllerprompt] will cycle through the different events.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

This combat preview is shown prior to any attack. All participating armies are shown, and you will also see an indication of the enemy army's strength compared to your own forces.[br/][br/]When an army is attacked, the [hyperlink,000003AC000000B1]Adjacent Hex Rule[/hyperlink] will cause adjacent armies to be drawn in.

Cell.ss:HRef: mailto:%7BXML_TUTORIAL@COMBAT_ENTER@TUTORIAL_DESCRIPTION%7D[br/][br]At the bottom of the interface, the choice between [hyperlink,000003AC000002EE]Manual and Auto Combat[/hyperlink] is available, as well as the option%
Cell.Data: {XML_TUTORIAL@COMBAT_ENTER@TUTORIAL_DESCRIPTION}[br/][br]At the bottom of the interface, the choice between [hyperlink,000003AC000002EE]Manual and Auto Combat[/hyperlink] is available, as well as the option to abort the attack.
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

When engaging an [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] in combat, all armies [hyperlink,000003AC000000B1]adjacent[/hyperlink] to the defending army that are allied to either the defending army or the attacking army are drawn into combat as well.

A colony militia has joined this battle, meaning the defender has extra units involved. When engaging in combat on a [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003BD000016D6]Province Sector Base,[/hyperlink] there is always a colony militia present. The colony militia can be upgraded by building the [hyperlink,000003AC000000D5]Militia Structures[/hyperlink] in the colony center.

Commanders can choose to lead battles themselves using the [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] system. Help messages are available for new commanders to learn the basics of combat.[br/][br/]Start the Combat tutorial?
The battle has started, Commander! The defending army always gets to act first, followed by the attackers.

During a combat turn, each unit has 3 [hyperlink,000003AC0000028D]Action Points[/hyperlink] to spend on using their abilities, which can cost between 1 and 3 action points. Regardless of cost, using an ability always ends the unit’s turn.[br/][br/]The [hyperlink,000003AC00000333]Tactical Movement Colors[/hyperlink] on the ground indicate how many action points the unit will have left after moving there. The red overlay on the ground means the unit will be left with no action points after movement.

[hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]Commanders[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Heroes[/hyperlink] are some of the strongest units in any army, capable of wielding a variety of powerful weapons and even piloting vehicles. They level up as they gain experience, allowing them to unlock new abilities and buffs.[br/][br/]If a commander is defeated in combat, they will return to their faction's [hyperlink,000003AC000000E3]Headquarters[/hyperlink] after a certain number of turns. Heroes do not have this special protection.

Each unit has active abilities that they can use during combat. Next to attacks, they have a [hyperlink,000003AC000002E6]Guard Ability[/hyperlink] which increases the unit’s defenses until the start of their next turn. Guard abilities always cost 1 action point.[br/][br/]The maximum range of the unit's currently selected ability will be displayed using a white line on the battlefield.[br/][br/]You can select enemy units to see their abilities and how they can use them.

{XML_TUTORIAL@TC_ABILITIES@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]Holding down the ALT button will allow your units to target obstacles or the ground, which is useful when using Area of Effect abilities.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

{XML_TUTORIAL@TC_ABILITIES@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/][recommendedcol]To allow your units to target obstacles or the ground, the Free Targeting option can be toggled on and off using the [controllerprompt][xbox_rs_press/][/controllerprompt] button. This functionality is useful when using Area of Effect abilities.[/recommendedcol]
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.

Try moving your units forward to form a gunline, Commander. There are several nearby obstacles that your Vanguard Troopers can take cover behind, symbolized by a shield icon when hovering over the hex in cover.[br/][br/]Try putting your Troopers in cover and enable [hyperlink,000003AC000000C8]Overwatch[/hyperlink] on them (the red eye symbol). The Assault Bike has great mobility and is best moved into a flanking position to engage in combat next turn.

A unit has been [hyperlink,000003AC000002DE]Staggered,[/hyperlink] causing it to lose an action point![br/][br/]Most melee attacks and explosives will stagger units. If a unit is in [hyperlink,000003AC000000C8]Overwatch[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC000002E6]Guard Mode,[/hyperlink] they are canceled when the unit is staggered.

Most abilities that are used on enemy units have an [hyperlink,000003AC0000030C]Accuracy[/hyperlink] [accuracy/] rating, which is the chance that the ability hits the intended target. [br/][br/]If an ability misses, it will either strike another target or do nothing at all. Some abilities can also [hyperlink,000003AC0000030D]Graze,[/hyperlink] meaning that the ability affected its target but with reduced strength.

Units with high [hyperlink,000003AC000000C3]Morale[/hyperlink] [happiness/] have a chance to score a [hyperlink,000003AC000002DC]Critical Hit[/hyperlink] when using offensive abilities. Critical hits always hit the target and deal increased damage.[br/][br/]Units that have low morale [anger/] have a chance to [hyperlink,000003AC000002DC]Fumble[/hyperlink] their attacks. Fumbled attacks always miss the intended target, but can still hit other targets.

A friendly unit has moved into [hyperlink,000003AC000000B3]Cover.[/hyperlink] Cover protects the unit by making it harder for enemies to hit them with abilities. Cover is directional, and only protects against attacks if it is between the targeted unit and the enemy.[br/][br/]Some units are too large to use cover, but they can be used as cover by other, smaller units.[br/][br/]Throughout the combat map, there are also large [hyperlink,000003AC00000320]Obstacles[/hyperlink] that block line of sight, allowing units hiding behind them to avoid being targeted altogether.

After the first round of combat, [hyperlink,0000039E00000072]Tactical Operations[/hyperlink] can be launched by both sides. Tactical operations can be accessed using the operations interface button in the bottom right of the screen.[br/][br/]A player can only launch a tactical operation during their turn, and only one can be launched each turn. Launching tactical operations costs energy [energy/] and [hyperlink,000003AC0000002C]Operation Points[/hyperlink] [castingtactical/].
{XML_TUTORIAL@TC_OPERATIONS@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br]You can open the operations interface and launch the 'Laser Strike' operation to deal heavy Thermal[damageThermal/] damage and stagger your opponents.
The part between {} brackets is a linking to the message referenced in the link, above this entry, and inserting that message before this message.
REQUIRED FOR VOICE-OVER / The thing between brackets at the start is the message referenced in the link, above this entry (cell C129). This message will read as C129 + C130.

A unit attacked from the sides or back is considered [hyperlink,000003AC000002DB]Flanked[/hyperlink] and takes increased damage. Units in [hyperlink,000003AC000002E6]Guard Mode[/hyperlink] cannot be flanked.[br/][br/]Units can be [hyperlink,000003AC000000D2]turned[/hyperlink] to face any direction, but units that have used an ability can no longer be turned. Abilities that require a target will always turn a unit towards that target.

Some units with ranged attacks can enter [hyperlink,000003AC000000C8]Overwatch.[/hyperlink] While in overwatch mode, the unit will have a red eye icon above its head. This unit will fire its primary ranged attack at any enemy unit that moves or uses an ability on a hex within this unit's field of view.[br/][br/]Overwatch can only trigger once per unit, and if a unit using overwatch is [hyperlink,000003AC000002DE]Staggered,[/hyperlink] the overwatch mode is canceled.

Units with melee attacks will enter [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF7]Melee Overwatch[/hyperlink] at the end of their turn, denoted by a red sword icon above their heads. While this unit is in melee overwatch, they will use their primary melee ability against any enemy unit that moves or uses an ability next to them[br/][br/]Melee overwatch can only trigger once per unit. If this unit is [hyperlink,000003AC000002DE]Staggered,[/hyperlink] the overwatch is canceled.
Adjusted duplicate text to work via string insert
A unit has just entered Melee Overwatch adjacent to one of its enemies![br/][br/]{XML_TUTORIAL@TC_OVERWATCH_MELEE@GENERAL_DESCRIPTION}
Adjusted duplicate text to work via string insert
A unit has just been hit by Melee Overwatch![br/][br/]{XML_TUTORIAL@TC_OVERWATCH_MELEE@GENERAL_DESCRIPTION}
Adjusted duplicate text to work via string insert

Units that survive a combat encounter gain [hyperlink,000003AC000000A1]Experience[/hyperlink] based on the number of enemies that were defeated during that combat. A unit that has earned sufficient experience levels up and can gain various bonuses.[br/][br/]Each unit in the battle earns experience equal to the total combat experience divided by the number of friendly units that entered the battle.

All rival [hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]Commanders[/hyperlink] and native [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Factions[/hyperlink] you encounter on the planet are listed in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000330]Diplomacy[/hyperlink] interface, along with faction information and their relation towards you. [br/][br/]You can start negotiations by selecting the faction you wish to speak with.

This is the [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]Negotiations[/hyperlink] interface. Diplomatic alliances can be forged and trade can be conducted here. The left list contains things that you can offer, and on the right list are things you can request from the other faction. The current offer is located in the bottom on each side. The options in the middle allow you to send the proposal, cancel it, or request that the other faction balances the trade to their satisfaction.

The Objectives interface gives an overview of available objectives. [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]Quests[/hyperlink] can come from [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Factions[/hyperlink] or from special sources during the campaign.[br/][br/]Quests given by NPC factions can offer military or economic rewards, and will improve your relations with that faction.

In addition to regular quests, the game features [hyperlink,000003AC00000270]Empire Tasks.[/hyperlink] These are divided into three categories, each representing an important pillar of your faction. Progressing through these empire tasks yields rewards and sets you on a path to victory. Being the first commander to complete a task gives you an extra pioneer reward.

The active [hyperlink,000003AC00000324]Victory Conditions[/hyperlink] for the current session can be seen here, as well as your progress in each condition. Once researched, a [hyperlink,000003AC000002B0]Capability Rank[/hyperlink] is shown for each category, showing how well you are doing compared to the other players in the game.[br/][br/][hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink] can be used to gather extra information on non-allied players.
Fixed issue with [br/][br/] tags being placed at the wrong place (before the a, instead of before the Cov Ops link)

The Unit Template Manager interface shows you mod templates for units under your control. [br/][br/]Templates can be removed, and new templates can be created by modifying an existing template.[br/][br/]You can toggle the visibility of the templates in the colony production screen using the checkbox next to each template.

The Colony Overview interface shows important information on all your colonies. Your HQ colony is marked with the [throne/] icon. The icons at the top can be used to sort the list based on the category selected.

The Military Overview interface shows important information about your armies, heroes and items. All military assets you control are listed here and selecting an army or hero will take you to their position on the world map. The Items tab lists all items currently in the shared inventory which all heroes have access to.

The Imperial Archives is a collection of all the information currently known to the Star Union. The tabs at the top can be used to navigate different categories of the archives and the filters at the top left of each category can be used to filter out sub-categories. The search function can be used to find specific topics within the archives and is not bound to the category you are currently in.

When all suggested actions from the [hyperlink,000003AC000000B9]Task Notifier[/hyperlink] above the minimap have been handled, the option will automatically change to 'End Turn'.[br/][br/]Since you've moved your units and started production in your colony, no more actions can be undertaken, so all that's left is to end the turn.

Operations ('ops') form a flexible toolkit that allows commanders to support military actions and steer government policies.[br/][br/]Ops of increasing strength are unlocked through research, and are listed on the left side of the operations interface. They are subdivided into three categories: [hyperlink,0000039E00000072]Tactical Operations,[/hyperlink] [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines.[/hyperlink]

Strategic and doctrine operations need to be primed before use. The priming process takes a number of turns pending the op's cost and your available Strategic [hyperlink,000003AC0000002B]Operation Points[/hyperlink] [casting/].[br/][br/]Doctrine operations are automatically activated when they finish priming. Strategic operations, such as air strikes, can be launched on your orders. Note you can keep multiple ops primed at once.

Commander, one of our colonies is unhappy! Growing populations generate unhappiness as each colonist adds an amount of happiness upkeep. Certain enemy actions can also cause unrest. [br/][br/]Unhappiness is remedied by building certain structures in the colony center, or by assigning colonists to [hyperlink,000003AC00000026]Happiness[/hyperlink] slots.[br/][br/]Once colony unhappiness reaches a particular threshold, an [hyperlink,000003AC000002BE]Unhappiness Event[/hyperlink] will occur, leading to [hyperlink,000003AC000002B4]Riots[/hyperlink] and loss of income for the colony.

To create Xenoplague units, you will need to infect enemy units in tactical combat with 'Parasitic Infection' by using unit mods and tactical operations that are unlocked through research.[br/][br/]At the end of a successful combat, the more enemy units that were infected, the higher the chance that you will gain a Xenoplague unit, or evolve an existing Xenoplague unit. The spawn chance increases the higher the tier of the infected units that died.[br/][br/]Each combat, multiple units can be spawned, evolved or a combination of both. Before Xenoplague units can be evolved, they need to be researched.

Combat cards allow you to fight manual combat in a multiplayer game. You need at least one combat card to initiate manual combat, and that card will be consumed upon doing so. In classic turns, combat cards are only spend against other human players. You only have a limited amount of combat cards and will regain a combat card after a set amount of turns, unless you already have the maximum amount of combat cards.

[hyperlink,000003AC000003E1]Anomalous Sites[/hyperlink] can be explored by a hero to earn rewards such as resources, equipment, or new units.[br/][br/]Occupy the site to discover how to explore it using combat, resources, or patience. Anomalous sites increase in difficulty from small to large, granting better rewards for higher risks.
